Please create a JSON array of xDO_Demo_Configuration__c in the following format and do not add anything other than this format:
{"xDO_Primary_Color_HEX_Code__c":"#FFFFFF","xDO_Secondary_Color_HEX_Code__c":"#FFFFFF","xDO_Accent_Color_1_HEX_Code__c":"#FFFFFF","xDO_Accent_Color_2_HEX_Code__c":"#FFFFFF","xDO_Accent_Color_3_HEX_Code__c":"#FFFFFF","xDO_Accent_Color_4_HEX_Code__c":"#FFFFFF"}
INSTRUCTIONS * Set the colors based on the colors in the Logo file attached. * Given the Company name is: {!$Input:CompanyName}, if you know their colors you can use those too. * Do not start the response with ```json * Do not include brackets around the object [] * Make sure colors do not repeat. * All values must be HEX codes (e.g., #FFFFFF) — never use names, RGB, or HSL values. * If you're unsure of a color, pick a variation of a known color. * Never set the colors to a value that is not a HEX code.
FIELD VALUES * The xDO_Primary_Color_HEX_Code__c must be the most prominent (primary) color in the company logo. * The xDO_Secondary_Color_HEX_Code__c must be the second most prominent color. * xDO_Accent_Color_1_HEX_Code__c should be a lighter complexion of any brand or logo color. * xDO_Accent_Color_2_HEX_Code__c should be a darker complexion of any brand or logo color. * xDO_Accent_Color_3_HEX_Code__c should be another lighter complexion. * xDO_Accent_Color_4_HEX_Code__c should be another darker complexion. * If there are not enough brand colors to assign distinct values for all six fields, use neutral shades such as white, light gray, gray, and black as needed. * If no logo is provided and no company is known, default all colors to #FFFFFF.
